endemo2.utility.utility¶

Functions

combine_data_on_x(xys1, xys2[, ascending_x])

Zip the two lists of tuples on the condition that the first tuple entry matches.

convert_table_to_filtered_data_series_per_country(df)

Create a dictionary from a table.

cut_after_x(data, last_x)

Cuts the tail of a list, according to first entry of tuple being larger than last_x.

exp_change(start_point, change_rate, target_x)

Calculates the result of exponential growth on a start point.

filter_out_nan_and_inf(data)

Filters out all entries in the list of tuples, where one of the values is either Inf or NaN.

is_permissible_float(x)

Checks if a string could be converted to a float that is not NaN or Inf, without throwing an exception.

is_tuple_list_zero(xys)

A wrapper for the is_zero function that applies it on a list of tuples, where only the second entries in a tuple are checked for being zero.

is_zero(xs)

Checks for a list of floats if there are only zeroes present in it.

lin_prediction(coef, target_x)

Calculates the result of a linear function according to given coefficients.

linear_regression(data[, visualize])

Apply linear regression on data and return the coefficients.

map_data_y(xys, function)

Applies the given function component-wise on the y-axis of the given data.

plot_timeseries(ts[, title, x_label, y_label])

Show a timeseries plotted with different optional labels.

quadr_prediction(coef, target_x)

Calculates the result of a quadratic function according to given coefficients.

quadratic_regression(data[, visualize])

Apply quadratic regression on data and return the coefficients.

quadratic_regression_delta(data[, visualize])

str_dict(dictionary)

Used to convert a dictionary to a string in a more readable form than if we would use the regular python implementation.

zip_data_on_x_and_map(xys1, xys2, function)

Combines two data lists and applies the given function to them.

zip_on_x(a, b)

A helper function for combine_data_on_x.
